endpoints.description: Get all comments for a task
Create new comment for a task
Get all history for a task

project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

databaseRecommendations.name: PostgreSQL
reasons: support for advanced indexing for efficient search and filter
cons: may require additional configuration for real-time sync
whyForUseCase: supports basic authentication and data privacy compliance
efficient handling of task history and audit logs

databaseRecommendations.name: MySQL
reasons: easy to set up and manage
pros: supports a wide range of storage engines
cons: may not be as scalable as other options
whyForUseCase: can handle small team usage with real-time sync

databaseRecommendations.name: Redis
reasons: in-memory data storage for fast access
supports pub/sub messaging for real-time sync
pros: easy to set up and manage
cons: may require additional configuration for data persistence
whyForUseCase: supports real-time sync and task updates

databaseRecommendations.name: SQLite
reasons: easy to set up and manage
cons: may not be suitable for large teams
whyForUseCase: can handle small team usage with limited real-time sync

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Break down the application into smaller, independent services for tasks, categories, and authentication to improve maintainability, scalability, and fault tolerance. Use RESTful APIs for communication between services.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis for real-time data synchronization across the application, enabling instant updates for task changes, additions, and deletions. Implement pub/sub messaging for efficient data dissemination.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement OAuth 2.0 for Authentication
smartRecommendations.description: Use OAuth 2.0 protocol for secure authentication and authorization, allowing users to log in with existing accounts (e.g., Google, GitHub) and ensuring basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

smartRecommendations.title: Optimize Database Queries with Indexing
smartRecommendations.description: Apply indexing to frequently queried columns (e.g., task due dates, categories) to improve query performance and reduce database load. Regularly monitor and optimize database queries to ensure efficient data retrieval.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Load Balancing for Scalability
smartRecommendations.description: Implement load balancing to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances of the application, ensuring high availability and scalability. Use cloud providers (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) for easy load balancer setup and management.

smartRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data
smartRecommendations.description: Encrypt sensitive user data (e.g., passwords, personal info) using a secure encryption algorithm (e.g., AES) to ensure data protection and compliance with data privacy regulations.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create indexes on task categories and due dates
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create database indexes on the categories and due dates columns in the tasks table to improve query performance when filtering and searching tasks. This will reduce the time it takes to retrieve tasks and improve the overall user experience.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement caching for frequently accessed data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis or an in-memory caching solution to store frequently accessed data such as user settings, categories, and priorities. This will reduce the number of database queries and improve application performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize task retrieval queries
optimizationSuggestions.description: Optimize the queries used to retrieve tasks, such as using LIMIT and OFFSET to reduce the amount of data transferred, and using efficient sorting and filtering algorithms. This will improve the performance of the application and reduce the load on the database.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use a load balancer to distribute traffic
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use a load balancer to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances of the application, improving scalability and reducing the load on individual instances. This will ensure that the application can handle a large number of users and requests.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. This will improve the security of the application and prevent unauthorized access.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule regular database backups and cleanups
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular database backups and cleanups to ensure that the database remains healthy and optimized. This will prevent data loss and improve the overall performance of the application.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement monitoring and alerting for application performance
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement monitoring and alerting tools to track application performance and alert administrators to potential issues. This will improve the responsiveness of the application and prevent downtime.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add MFA to the login process to prevent unauthorized access. Users should be required to provide a second form of verification, such as a code sent to their phone or a biometric scan, in addition to their password.

securityRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data
securityRecommendations.description: Encrypt all sensitive data, including user passwords, task descriptions, and comments, both in transit and at rest. Use a secure encryption algorithm like AES-256 and store encryption keys securely.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
securityRecommendations.description: Implement RBAC to restrict access to tasks and features based on user roles. For example, team administrators should have access to all tasks, while regular users should only have access to their own tasks.

securityRecommendations.title: Use Secure Password Storage
securityRecommendations.description: Store user passwords securely using a password hashing algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2. Avoid storing plaintext passwords or using weak hashing algorithms like MD5.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security incidents. Log all security-related events, including login attempts, task modifications, and system changes.

securityRecommendations.title: Validate and Sanitize User Input
securityRecommendations.description: Validate and sanitize all user input to prevent SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. Use prepared statements and parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection, and use HTML escaping to prevent XSS.

indexingPriority.reason: Frequent search, filter, and real-time sync operations
Infrequent updates, mostly reads for authentication

performanceMetrics.label: Expected QPS
performanceMetrics.description: Queries per second estimate for small team usage

performanceMetrics.label: Data Growth
performanceMetrics.description: Estimated data growth rate for 100+ active users

bottlenecks: Frequent queries on the tasks table may cause a bottleneck, especially when retrieving task lists or task details, which could impact the performance of the Tasks API endpoints.
The task_comments table may experience high traffic due to the creation, retrieval, and deletion of comments, potentially causing a bottleneck in the Task Comments API endpoints.
securityIssues: Insecure data transmission between the client and server, particularly in the Authentication API endpoints, which could expose sensitive user credentials.
Lack of input validation and sanitization in the Tasks, Categories, and Task Comments API endpoints, making them vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.
cachingOpportunities: Caching frequently accessed task lists or task details in the Tasks API endpoints to reduce the number of database queries and improve response times.
Implementing caching for category lists in the Categories API endpoints, as categories are likely to be static or infrequently updated.
transformationPoints: Data transformation from the task_tags table to the tasks table, where task tags are aggregated and displayed as a list of tags for each task.
Data transformation from the task_comments table to the tasks table, where comment counts or latest comment information is displayed for each task.
highTrafficEndpoints: Tasks API endpoints, particularly those handling task creation, retrieval, and deletion, which may experience high traffic due to frequent user interactions.
Authentication API endpoints, which may experience high traffic during peak usage hours or when multiple users are logging in simultaneously.

relationships.description: A category can have multiple tasks, but a task belongs to only one category
A user can have multiple tasks, but a task is assigned to only one user
A task can have multiple tags, but a tag belongs to only one task
A task can have multiple comments, but a comment belongs to only one task
A task can have multiple history entries, but a history entry belongs to only one task
A user can have multiple comments, but a comment is made by only one user
A user can have multiple history entries, but a history entry is made by only one user
A user can have multiple audit logs, but an audit log is related to only one user

indexRecommendations.reason: Frequent joins with categories and users tables
Frequent filtering by task_id and user_id
Frequent filtering by task_id and user_id

normalizationIssues.issue: Tasks table has 11 fields, which may indicate a lack of normalization
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider breaking down tasks table into smaller tables, such as task_details and task_status

normalizationIssues.issue: Task comments table has 7 fields, which may indicate a lack of normalization
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider breaking down task_comments table into smaller tables, such as comment_text and comment_metadata

performanceWarnings: Frequent inserts, updates, and deletes on the tasks table may lead to performance issues
The audit_logs table may grow rapidly and require regular maintenance to prevent performance issues
The task_history table may grow rapidly and require regular maintenance to prevent performance issues
The task_tags table may require regular maintenance to prevent performance issues due to frequent inserts and deletes

endpoints.description: Get task by id - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id} (Auth Required)
Get category by id - GET /api/v1/categories/{id} (Auth Required)
Get all comments for a task - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id}/comments (Auth Required)
Create new comment for a task - POST /api/v1/tasks/{id}/comments (Auth Required)
Get comment by id - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id}/comments/{comment_id} (Auth Required)
Get all history for a task - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id}/history (Auth Required)
Get setting by id - GET /api/v1/settings/{id} (Auth Required)
Get all audit logs - GET /api/v1/audit-logs (Auth Required)

flows.label: Categories  Task Comments: API workflow connection
Task Comments  Task History: API workflow connection
Task History  Settings: API workflow connection
Settings  Audit Logs: API workflow connection

restIssues: /api/v1/tasks/{id}/comments/{comment_id} should be /api/v1/tasks/{taskId}/comments/{commentId} for better readability and to follow REST naming conventions
/api/v1/settings/{id} should consider using a more descriptive identifier, such as /api/v1/settings/{settingName} or /api/v1/settings/{settingId}
/api/v1/categories and /api/v1/tasks have similar endpoints, consider extracting common logic into a separate service or utilizing a more generic endpoint structure
securityRecommendations: /api/v1/auth/login and /api/v1/auth/register should implement rate limiting to prevent brute-force attacks
/api/v1/tasks/{id} and /api/v1/categories/{id} should validate user permissions before allowing updates or deletions
/api/v1/settings/{id} should restrict access to authorized users, as settings may contain sensitive information
/api/v1/audit-logs should be restricted to admin users only, as it contains sensitive information about system activity
missingEndpoints: /api/v1/categories/{id}/tasks to retrieve tasks associated with a category
/api/v1/users to manage user information, such as profiles or preferences
/api/v1/tasks/{id}/attachments to manage task attachments, such as files or images
aiInsights.rateLimiting: Apply rate limiting to /api/v1/auth/login, /api/v1/auth/register, and /api/v1/tasks/{id} to prevent abuse and denial-of-service attacks
aiInsights.versioning: The current versioning strategy uses a URI path prefix (/api/v1/), which is a common approach. Consider using header-based versioning (e.g., Accept: application/vnd.taskmanager.v1+json) for more flexibility and to avoid URI clutter.

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and categories with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

recommendations.name: MySQL
recommendations.description: Popular open-source relational database known for reliability, ease of use, and wide adoption in web applications with strong read performance

pricing.details: Free and open-source, hosting costs vary

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for this task management application due to its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for tasks and user information, excellent support for complex queries needed for task filtering and sorting, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway solution for managing API requests, security, and routing

recommendations.name: Kong
recommendations.description: Popular open-source API gateway with plugin architecture, providing features such as authentication, rate limiting, and caching

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: AWS API Gateway
recommendations.description: Fully managed API gateway service provided by AWS, offering features such as security, monitoring, and analytics
pros: Fully managed service with high availability
cons: Pricing can be complex and costly

pricing.details: Pay-per-use pricing model, with discounts for high-volume usage

decisions.reasoning: Kong is recommended for its high customizability with plugins, strong community support, and free and open-source nature. Although it has a complex setup, the flexibility and cost-effectiveness make it a suitable choice for this task management application.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the continuous integration and deployment platform for automating build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation.

decisions.title: Monitoring Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the monitoring solution for tracking application performance, errors, and system health

recommendations.name: Prometheus
recommendations.description: Popular open-source monitoring system and time series database, providing features such as metrics collection, alerting, and visualization
pros: Supports multiple data sources and formats

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: Datadog
recommendations.description: Cloud-based monitoring and analytics platform, providing features such as metrics collection, log analysis, and application performance monitoring
pros: Fully managed service with high availability
Tight integration with cloud providers and services
Supports multiple data sources and formats
cons: Pricing can be complex and costly

pricing.details: Pay-per-host pricing model, with discounts for annual commitments

decisions.reasoning: Prometheus is recommended for its high customizability, strong community support, and free and open-source nature. Although it has a complex setup, the flexibility and cost-effectiveness make it a suitable choice for this task management application.

technical: PostgreSQL requires careful query optimization to maintain performance at scale
Kong API Gateway requires complex setup and configuration
Prometheus monitoring system requires resource-intensive setup
operational: Team needs training on AWS services and best practices
CI/CD pipeline maintenance requires ongoing attention
Monitoring system alerts and notifications require configuration
financial: AWS costs can increase rapidly with traffic growth without proper monitoring
Database storage costs will scale with data volume
Need to implement cost monitoring and alerts to prevent budget overruns
